00020 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00021 #include "copynumber/Indexer.h"
00022 //
00023 
00024 using namespace std;
00025 
00026 // Conversion of probe IDs to row and column indices and the inverse.
00027 // Note that the probe ID is assumed to be from a cyto2 array because
00028 // of the way that probe IDs are mapped to positions.  When looking at
00029 // the image with the logo in the top left corner, rows start at the top
00030 // and columns start at the left.  That is, a right hand coordinate
00031 // system.  Probe IDs start at 1 in the top right corner of the image
00032 // then go downward to the bottom and proceed into the next column
00033 // just to the left.
00034 
00035 // probe ID to row colunn.  row is .first, column is .second. 
00036 pair<int,int> index_to_rc(int probe_id, int ncol)
00037         {
00038         int pos = probe_id - 1;
00039         return make_pair<int,int>(pos % ncol, ncol - pos/ncol - 1);
00040         }
00041 
00042 // row and column to probe ID.
00043 int rc_to_index(int row, int col, int ncol)
00044         {
00045         return ncol*(ncol - col - 1) + row + 1;
00046         }
00047 
00048 pair<int,int> probeid_to_rc(int probe_id, int nrow, int ncol)
00049         {
00050         int row = (probe_id - 1) % nrow;
00051         int col = ncol - (probe_id - 1)/nrow - 1;
00052         return make_pair<int,int>(row,col);
00053         }
00054
